page.title: 09Housing\Barby\Willoughby
page.content: The housing in our D-block is varied ranging from three hundred year old stone farmhouses to the latest in design and construction techniques. Daventry Road, Barby, presents an interesting picture. Brick terraced council built homes occupy one side while privately owned bungalows occupy the other. In recent years it has been the policy of the Conservative Gov- ernment to sell off council houses. This has meant that a number of council houses are now privately owned. A recent national survey has found that because of high levels of unemployment a growing number of new owner occupiers cannot meet the high cost of repairs. The survey reports that one house in five is in need of major repairs. To make matters worse home improvement grants have been drastically cut.
